definition: To contract or wrinkle the skin, typically caused by frowning, squinting, or expressing disapproval. This action is commonly observed on the face, particularly around the forehead, eyebrows, or eyes.

examples.german: Der alte Mann runzelte die Nase.
examples.english: The old man wrinkled his nose.

examples.german: Die Falten runzelten sich um seine Augen.
examples.english: The wrinkles gathered around his eyes.

examples.german: Er runzelte die Stirn, als er die Nachricht hörte.
examples.english: He frowned when he heard the news.

examples.german: Die Hitze ließ ihre Haut runzeln.
examples.english: The heat made her skin wrinkle.
